@staypuff wrote:

Welp item used on item is pretty basic code that can’t really be edited to much. Trust me though I made that myself.

Chaospkers,

what I want is to have all the item used with other things removed from client.java and placed into a new file called itemused.java then I want to make it so that the client knows to look there for those codes when some one uses an item on another item/object/or whatever else you can use it with.

Could you give me more info on the other codes you gave me, where to put them and what they would do?

item.title: Really need help!@#!@ will rep!
item.dc:creator: @staypuff staypuff
item.description:
@staypuff wrote:

Ok well in client.java of my 317 source, i added this these to make god swords from shards & hilts:

////////////////////////////////////GOD SWORDS START//////////////////////////////////// if(((itemUsed == 3649) && (otherItem == 3650)) || ((itemUsed == 3650) && (otherItem == 3649))) {deleteItem(3650, getItemSlot(3650), 1); deleteItem(3649, getItemSlot(3649), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3652, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 13); sM("The Shards Magicaly Fuse Together."); } if(((itemUsed == 3650) && (otherItem == 3651)) || ((itemUsed == 3651) && (otherItem == 3650))) {deleteItem(3650, getItemSlot(3650), 1); deleteItem(3651, getItemSlot(3651), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3655, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 13); sM("The Shards Magicaly Fuse Together."); } if(((itemUsed == 3651) && (otherItem == 3649)) || ((itemUsed == 3649) && (otherItem == 3651))) {deleteItem(3651, getItemSlot(3651), 1); deleteItem(3649, getItemSlot(3649), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3653, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 13); sM("The Shards Magicaly Fuse Together."); //Shard 3 + Shard 1 = (Shards-3&1) } if(((itemUsed == 3649) && (otherItem == 3655)) || ((itemUsed == 3655) && (otherItem == 3649))) {deleteItem(3649, getItemSlot(3649), 1); deleteItem(3655, getItemSlot(3655), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 13); sM("The Shards Fuse Together Forming A Blade."); } if(((itemUsed == 3650) && (otherItem ==3653)) || ((itemUsed == 3653) && (otherItem == 3650))) {deleteItem(3650, getItemSlot(3650), 1); deleteItem(3653, getItemSlot(3653), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 13); sM("The Shards Fuse Together Forming A Blade."); } if(((itemUsed == 3651) && (otherItem == 3652)) || ((itemUsed == 3652) && (otherItem == 3651))) {deleteItem(3651, getItemSlot(3651), 1); deleteItem(3652, getItemSlot(3652), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(2000, 13); sM("The Shards Fuse Together Forming A Blade."); } if(((itemUsed == 3654) && (otherItem == 2779)) || ((itemUsed == 2779) && (otherItem == 3654))) {deleteItem(3654, getItemSlot(3654), 1); deleteItem(2779, getItemSlot(2779), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(10000, 13); sM("The Blade Becomes Fastened Into The Hilt Forming A Saradomin God Sword."); } if(((itemUsed == 3654) && (otherItem == 2780)) || ((itemUsed == 2780) && (otherItem == 3654))) {deleteItem(3654, getItemSlot(3654), 1); deleteItem(2780, getItemSlot(2780), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(15000, 13); sM("The Blade Becomes Fastened Into The Hilt Forming A Zamorak God Sword."); } if(((itemUsed == 3654) && (otherItem == 2777)) || ((itemUsed == 2777) && (otherItem == 3654))) {deleteItem(3654, getItemSlot(3654), 1); deleteItem(2777, getItemSlot(2777), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(20000, 13); sM("The Blade Becomes Fastened Into The Hilt Forming A Bandos God Sword."); } if(((itemUsed == 3654) && (otherItem == 2778)) || ((itemUsed == 2778) && (otherItem == 3654))) {deleteItem(3654, getItemSlot(3654), 1); deleteItem(2778, getItemSlot(2778), 1); setAnimation(885); addItem(3654, 1); addSkillXP(25000, 13); sM("The Blade Becomes Fastened Into The Hilt Forming An Armadyl God Sword."); }

After Compiling I Get This Error:

After Deleting A Previous Code For Making Arrows, It Compiled Fine, After Re-adding The Arrow Coding It Gave Me The Same Error.

Now I’m Not Retarded And Understand That It Is Telling Me That The Code Is Too Big Or Client.java Is Too Big. But, What I Was Wondering Is How Can I Make It So That It Loads All The Item Used With Item/Object/Or What Ever Else… Load From A Seperate Java File. I Know This Is Possible As I Have Seen It Done On Other Sources But Have No Idea How To Do It Myself.

Any help towards solving this problem even if it doesn’t include the way I suggested, It will be appreciated greatly.

Read full topic
